}} 'Tinidazole' is an anti-parasitic drug used against protozoan infections. It
is widely known throughout Europe and the developing world as a treatment for a
variety of amoebic and parasitic infections. It was developed in 1972.

Tinidazole is marketed by Mission Pharmacal under the brand name 'Tindamax', by
Pfizer under the names 'Fasigyn' and 'Simplotan', and in some Asian countries as
'Sporinex'.
